column4: while were at the topic when running two screens with twinview the dialogs open with delay. any ideas?4
http://paste.ubuntu.com/29687/
if you give some more detail what the problem is

I had to manually edit my xorg.conf to get my computer to recognize the drivers, and now when I go to Nvidia X Server Settings Dialog it says I am not using the Nvidia X Drivers.  When I run the suggested command I get sent back to low graphics mode.  I need to get into the settings dialog, or else I cannot enable OpenGL
did you try nvidia-xconfig?
that is the command that sends me back to low graphics mode
unfortunately it doesn't.  It makes my driver nvidia, but it needs to be nv.
when you set driver to nv it breaks down to low graphics?
no, when I set it to nv it works.  nvidia-xconfig sets my driver as nvidia, and then I get sent down to low graphics mode.
i believe nv is the open source driver for nvidia cards which may explain why nvidia-settings doesnt like it
I had it working with nv as the driver setting before.. but after a reboot everything stopped working.
does /var/log/Xorg.0.log give any hints?
no idea.. I can't interpret that.  want me to paste it for you?
in query please, the last 10 lines or sth should be sufficient
double click my nick in the list
oh, ok
that are the first lines arent they?
nope.  the last
okay, that doenst help indeed
would seeing the whole thing help?  or not?
give it a try
